alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:24PM MST until July 31 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 620 PM MST, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated that light rain continued to fall in the Flash Flood Warning area. As much as 2.5 inches of rain accumulated this afternoon. Area washes and creeks are likely still running higher than normal this evening. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... western portions of Camp Verde, Middle Verde, Cornville, Verde Village, Bridgeport and Cottonwood. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 218. Interstate 17 between mile markers 285 and 287. State Route 89A between mile markers 356 and 359. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Oak Creek, Cherry Creek, Grief Hill Wash and Gaddis Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
